entity.name: Browser support
entity.description: Browser support, compatibility, and consistency issues.
entity.descriptionClean: Browser support, compatibility, and consistency issues.

entity.name: `<dialog>`
entity.description: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionClean: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.

example.code:
<dialog id="confirm">
	<form method="dialog">
		Are you sure?
		<button value="1">Yes</button>
		<button value="0">No</button>
	</form>
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <dialog id="confirm"> <form method="dialog"> Are you sure? <button value="1">Yes</button> <button value="0">No</button> </form> </dialog>

webFeature.description_html: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
webFeature.name: <dialog>

entity.name: Animations
entity.description: Animation issues
entity.descriptionClean: Animation issues

entity.name: `popover` attribute (Popover API)
entity.description: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

resources.title: The Popover API (previously Popup) · Issue #743 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
webFeature.name: Popover

entity.descriptionHtml: Issues related to the top layer, where elements like  and popovers are rendered. Includes z-index conflicts, stacking order control, and interactions between multiple top-layer elements.

entity.descriptionClean: role and aria-* attributes

example.code: Prices
example.codeHighlighted: <div id="tab1" aria-controls="panel1" role="tab">Prices</div> <div id="panel1" class="panel" aria-labelledby="tab1" role="tabpanel"> <!-- tab content --> </div>

entity.name: ARIA live regions
entity.description: Issues around ARIA live regions and generally announcing DOM changes to assistive technology.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around ARIA live regions and generally announcing DOM changes to assistive technology.

entity.name: Reliability
entity.description: Crashes, device/context loss, flaky behavior, and error handling.
entity.descriptionClean: Crashes, device/context loss, flaky behavior, and error handling.

entity.name: `command` and `commandfor` attributes (Command Invokers)
entity.description: A declarative way for `<button>` to invoke predefined custom commands.
entity.descriptionHtml: A declarative way for <button> to invoke predefined custom commands.
entity.descriptionClean: A declarative way for <button> to invoke predefined custom commands.

example.code:
<button commandfor="mydialog" command="show-modal">
  Show modal dialog
</button>
<dialog id="mydialog">
  <button commandfor="mydialog" command="close">
    Close
  </button>
  *dialog content*
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <button commandfor="mydialog" command="show-modal"> Show modal dialog </button> <dialog id="mydialog"> <button commandfor="mydialog" command="close"> Close </button> *dialog content* </dialog>

resources.title: Invoker Commands: Additional Ways to Work With Dialog, Popover… and More?

webFeature.description_html: The command and commandfor attributes for the <button> HTML element dispatch an action to an element when the button is invoked (by click or keystroke), as a declarative alternative to addEventListener() calls or onclick attribute handlers.
webFeature.name: Invoker commands

entity.name: Partial Page Updates
entity.description: The desire for a native mechanism to update parts of a page with HTML from a server response, without a full page reload, similar to what libraries like htmx or Turbo provide.
entity.descriptionClean: The desire for a native mechanism to update parts of a page with HTML from a server response, without a full page reload, similar to what libraries like htmx or Turbo provide.

entity.name: Missing elements
entity.description: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.
entity.descriptionClean: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.

entity.name: Carousel
entity.description: The lack of a native, declarative HTML element for creating carousels or sliders, forcing developers to build them from scratch.
entity.descriptionClean: The lack of a native, declarative HTML element for creating carousels or sliders, forcing developers to build them from scratch.

entity.name: Tabs element
entity.description: Pain points from the lack of a native HTML element for tabbed interfaces, a common UI pattern.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points from the lack of a native HTML element for tabbed interfaces, a common UI pattern.

entity.name: Server-client communication
entity.description: Issues around server-client integration & communication, server-side rendering, etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues around server-client integration & communication, server-side rendering, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around server-client integration & communication, server-side rendering, etc.

entity.name: SSR & hydration
entity.description: Performance bottlenecks related to the process of making server-rendered HTML interactive on the client using JavaScript frameworks.
entity.descriptionClean: Performance bottlenecks related to the process of making server-rendered HTML interactive on the client using JavaScript frameworks.

entity.description: Issues around getting one’s workplace to agree on certain policies and/or priorities.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around getting one’s workplace to agree on certain policies and/or priorities.

entity.descriptionClean: Debugging issues

entity.name: Shadow DOM
entity.description: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.
entity.descriptionClean: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.

example.codeHighlighted: this.shadowRoot = this.attachShadow({mode: "open"});

webFeature.description_html: Shadow DOM allows you to attach encapsulated "shadow" DOM trees to elements. A shadow DOM tree is a separate component, isolated from the scripts and styles in other parts of the document. This is a part of Web Components.
webFeature.name: Shadow DOM

entity.name: Cross-root issues
entity.description: Issues around crossing shadow boundaries.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around crossing shadow boundaries.

entity.name: Vendor politics
entity.description: Pain points arising from the strategic decisions, priorities, or market position of browser vendors or platform owners (e.g. Apple, Google).
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points arising from the strategic decisions, priorities, or market position of browser vendors or platform owners (e.g. Apple, Google).

entity.descriptionClean: Issues around third party tools, or lack thereof, including tooling in the browser (extensions, devtools, etc.).

entity.descriptionClean: Lack of native HTML imports or templating

entity.descriptionClean: E.g. poor integration between different features or web technologies

entity.name: `<dialog closedby="any">`
entity.description: Allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it (light dismiss).
entity.descriptionClean: Allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it (light dismiss).

webFeature.description_html: The closedby HTML attribute for <dialog> sets which user actions close a dialog. For example, closedby="any" allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it.
webFeature.name: <dialog closedby>

entity.name: Environments & Consumers
entity.description: Issues relevant to specific environments or consumers of web content, e.g. devices, bots, viewing modes, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues relevant to specific environments or consumers of web content, e.g. devices, bots, viewing modes, etc.

entity.name: Mobile vs Desktop
entity.description: Challenges around supporting both mobile and desktop, but not specifically about either of the two.
entity.descriptionClean: Challenges around supporting both mobile and desktop, but not specifically about either of the two.

entity.name: End-user experience
entity.description: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use `ergonomics` for that).
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use ergonomics for that).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use ergonomics for that).

entity.name: `dialog.requestClose()`
entity.description: Closes the dialog in a way that can be cancelled (unlike `dialog.close()`).
entity.descriptionHtml: Closes the dialog in a way that can be cancelled (unlike dialog.close()).
entity.descriptionClean: Closes the dialog in a way that can be cancelled (unlike dialog.close()).

webFeature.description_html: The requestClose() method of a <dialog> HTML element closes the dialog, firing a cancel event first, which listeners can use to prevent the dialog from closing. This differs from the close() method, which only fires the non-cancelable close event.
webFeature.name: dialog.requestClose()

entity.name: Animations

entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to UI animations across all technologies, regardless of technology used to implement them (CSS animations, Lottie, etc)

entity.descriptionClean: Nonsense or non‑actionable or off-topic content.

webFeature.description_html: The WebAssembly.instantiate() and WebAssembly.instantiateStreaming() global static methods load WebAssembly code (also known as Wasm), a portable binary instruction format.
webFeature.name: WebAssembly
